    • Method Detail

      • countDigits

        public static int countDigits(long n,
                              long r)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Counts the digits of a number. This concerns a non-negative integer, assumed to be written in positional notation without leading zeroes. Robust version.

        Parameters:
        n - the number whose digits are counted
        r - the radix
        Returns:
        the number of digits in n
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0 || r < 2
        Precondition:
        0 <= n && 2 <= r
        Postcondition:
        \result = (\min int k; 1 <= k; n < 10 ^ k)
